file_content.text: My lord, it looks like Thanaton's man will catch us before you arrive.
Corrin and I will try our best to stave him off, but Lord Cineratus is not a man to be trifled with.
The item we stole was the key to a hidden entrance to Darth Thanaton's private meditation chambers.
It is the perfect ambush spot for when you have enough power to face him.
If Corrin and I don't make it, we hope you'll avenge our deaths. Crush Thanaton, and usher in the new era for the Sith.
Looks as if we have two new travelers, the ghost and a little Jedi pet. Wonderful.
The pirate thinks he has another ghost story for us to investigate, too.
My lord! It's Kaal. Your apprentice. Corrin's here with me.
We don't have much time to talk. Thanaton tried to make us his. Claimed you were dead.
We managed to flee Dromund Kaas, but his lords have been hounding us through every sector.
You'd think he'd focus his efforts on me.
Why you?
We were part of Zash's power base, apparently we need to be destroyed as well.
Where are you now?
What's your position?
We've set a course for Quesh, a nasty little swamp world. The warfare on the planet should allow us to hide from Thanaton.
We need your help. We took something from Thanaton. Something to help you beat him.
Yawn.
My lord, Thanaton insults you by striking at us! It's a signal to other Sith--you're not worthy of apprentices!
Also, we might have... taken something from him. Something to help you beat him.
We can't talk about it here. If somebody's intercepting this, Thanaton will be at our throats.
I won't let Thanaton lay a finger on you.
Hold tight.
If you give me your location, I can help.
Where are you?
We're near Quesh. We're hoping the warfare there will provide a diversion.
I hope this is worth it.
We wouldn't risk our lives for a trifle, my lord.
Blast! Ship's hit... emergency landing on Quesh... hurry!
If Thanaton kills your apprentices, you will appear very weak indeed. It looks like hunting ghosts will have to wait.
